thread.title: The Lawn on D is turning into a giant pumpkin patch - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: The Lawn on D is turning into a giant pumpkin patch - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: The Lawn on D is turning into a giant pumpkin patch - Massachusetts news
text:
The Lawn on D will close in style this Columbus Day weekend by hosting the second annual “Punkin’ Fest.”
Related Links Meet the guy selling New England leaves for $19.99 13 fall festivals happening across New England Get today’s headlines right in your inbox On Saturday, each person will be allowed to carve one free pumpkin from the giant patch, according to the event website . The pumpkins will then be put on a large scaffolding, and have individually controlled lights placed in them to create a spooktacular light show.
 The goal is to create a 400-pumpkin spectacle, a colossal lit up “Punkin’ Manor,” twice as big as last year’s attempt. There will also be another, larger pumpkin patch for kids to decorate with stickers, paint, and markers.
This weekend marks the end of the public space’s run. The Lawn on D was started last summer as an experiment to utilize the unused space outside the Boston Convention & Exhibition Center.
The light show will run each half hour from dusk to 10 p.m. on Saturday, and sunset to 8 p.m. Sunday and Monday. Carving tools will be supplied, but guests are encouraged to bring their own pumpkins in case the Lawn runs out.
